name: Loft404
author: Loft Ocean

sections.description:
Loft404 is a small plugin to help redirect the default 404 page to a custom page. You can choose to enable it, then set the custom 404 page.

PS: The plugin does not create a custom 404 page for your site. You need to create a page and add content to it. By working with our another WP plugin LoftBuilder, you can easily create a beautiful page in minutes.

Features & Options

  • Turn on or off the custom 404 page.
  • Set any existing page as the custom 404 page.
sections.installation:
1. Install the plugin either via the WordPress.org plugin directory, or by uploading the files to your server (in the /wp-content/plugins/ directory).
  2. Activate the Loft404 plugin through the ‘Plugins’ menu in WordPress.
  3. In the WordPress administration screen, go to Settings > Loft404, check the settings there.
sections.faq:
No changes on activation/deactivation

  • If you have installed any caching plugins then clear the cache.
sections.changelog:
1.2.2

  • Add: remove header status 404 when in customize preview mode

1.2.1

  • Add: fix conflict with LoftBuilder

1.2.0

  • Add: send status code 404 to browser for custom 404 page, no cache for header

1.1.0

  • Update: redirect status code 301

1.0.0

  • Initial Public Release

short_description: A toolkit to redirect 404 page to your custom page.
